result.markdown:
---
title: "R Basics"
---

# R as a Calculator

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
1 + 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 2
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
3 * (4 + 5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 27
```


:::
:::


# Objects & Assignment

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- 10
y <- 3.5
x + y
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 13.5
```


:::
:::


# Getting Help

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
?mean
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
starting httpd help server ... done
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
help("lm")
```
:::


# Working Directory

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
getwd()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "D:/R2SAS/r4sas"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# setwd("/path/you/want") # avoid in reproducible code; prefer here::here() for projects
```
:::


# Vectors (Atomic)

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
nums <- c(1, 2, 3, 4)
chars <- c("a", "b", "c")
logical <- c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE)
typeof(nums); typeof(chars); typeof(logical)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "double"
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "character"
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "logical"
```


:::
:::


# Exercises
1. Create an object `z` that stores `(5^2 + 7)/3`.
2. Use `?seq` and create a sequence from 0 to 1 by 0.1.
3. Inspect `typeof()` for a few objects you create.
